orgId.description: The organization ID. The `API_KEY` must have admin access to this organization.

integrationId.description: The unique identifier for the configured integration. This can be found on the [Integration page in the Settings area](https://app.snyk.io/manage/integrations) for all integrations that have been configured.

autoDepUpgradeEnabled.description: Defines if the functionality is enabled

autoDepUpgradeIgnoredDependencies.description: A list of strings defining what dependencies should be ignored

autoDepUpgradeLimit.description: A limit on how many automatic dependency upgrade PRs can be opened simultaneously

autoDepUpgradeMinAge.description: The age (in days) that an automatic dependency check is valid for

backlogPrsEnabled.description: If true, allows automatic remediation of prioritized backlog issues

freshPrsEnabled.description: If true, allows automatic remediation of newly identified issues, or older issues where a fix has been identified

usePatchRemediation.description: If true, allows using patched remediation

dockerfileSCMEnabled.description: If true, will automatically detect and scan Dockerfiles in your Git repositories, surface base image vulnerabilities and recommend possible fixes

usePatchRemediation.description: If true, allows using patched remediation

assignees.description: an array of usernames that have contributed to the organization's project(s).

enabled.description: if the organization's project(s) will assign Snyk pull requests.

type.description: a string representing the type of assignment your projects require.

pullRequestFailOnAnyVulns.description: If an opened PR should fail to be validated if any vulnerable dependencies have been detected

pullRequestFailOnlyForHighSeverity.description: If an opened PR only should fail its validation if any dependencies are marked as being of high severity

pullRequestTestEnabled.description: If opened PRs should be tested
